12.1 CYBL Con?guration data
� Con?guration Data
Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit
NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM - 1... FH 1... 15 1 -
Number of cylinder banks for cylinder balancing homogenous
NC_NR_GEAR_BAL_HOM - 1... FH 1... 15 1 -
Number of used gear types for cylinder balancing homogenous
NC_NR_OFS_H_BAL_HOM - 1... FH 1... 15 1 -
Number of range high engine roughness offset tables for cylinder lean shift
NC_NR_OFS_IS_BAL_HOM - 1... FH 1... 15 1 -
Number of range idle speed engine roughness offset values for cylinder lean shift
NC_NR_OFS_L_BAL_HOM - 1... FH 1... 15 1 -
Number of range low engine roughness offset tables for cylinder lean shift
NC_NR_RNG_BAL_HOM - 1... FH 1... 15 1 -
Number of adaptation ranges for cylinder balancing homogenous
� General Information
The con?guration constant NC_NR_RNG_BAL_HOM is used to determine the number of available adaptation
ranges for cylinder balancing at homogenous combustion mode. It is possible to de?ne up to 15 adaptation
ranges with this constant. By default (generic version), three different adaptation ranges are de?ned. The
"RNG_L" range is used for low engine load while the "RNG_H" area is corresponding to high engine loads. For
service issues "RNG_IS" is de?ned to allow a basic cylinder balancing adaptation at the garage.
The con?guration constant NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM is used to determine the number of available cylinder
banks for balancing at homogenous combustion mode. In this case, the number of available cylinder banks
equals to the number of in reality existing exhaust lines (lambda sensors).
To allow the cylinder balancing function usage for different engine gear types (manual transmission, automatic
transmission,...) in combination with one and the same calibration data set, the calibration constant NC_NR_
GEAR_BAL_HOM is used. Dependent on the available number of gear types per vehicle platform, up to 15
variants are supported.
It is possible to force cylinder balancing at different injection modes as well as different valve lift positions
or in combination with further speci?c vehicle settings. In this case, for the different engine operation areas,
different lean shift ratios are necessary to achieve one and the same lambda offset. Therefore the con?guration
constants NC_NR_OFS_L(H/IS)_BAL_HOM are used. The number of de?ned offset values are re?ecting the
number of interpolation tables for cylinder lean shift (one to one relationship).

CYBL, Coordination of the injection time correction factors for CYBL
� Import actions:
ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(IN <PRM_FID>, OUT <PRM_LV_PRMS>)
� General Information
12.2.1 Coordination of the injection time correction factors for cylinder balancing
� General Information
Cylinder Balancing via TI intervention means a correction of the cylinder individual injection time values to
achieve a balancing of the indicated torque between the single cylinders based on engine roughness calcula-
tion. Target is to achieve a smooth engine running.
The coordination module is used to keep the cylinder balancing functions modular. Therefore the activation
conditions for the signal preparation functions and the cylinder balancing adaptation functions are set within
this module. The cylinder balancing functions are activated as soon as the corresponding activation condition
is enabled (=1).
With the logical variable LV_MFF_COR_ER_BAL_ENA_EXT it is possible to adapt the main enable condition (to
start cylinder balancing via TI intervention) with additional external requirements.
A logical calibration constant is available to stop all cylinder balancing interventions at once. In case of LC_TI_
ER_BAL_STOP_MAN = 1, several activation conditions for the cylinder balancing functions are disabled (=0). If
the logical constant is enabled (=1), a re-initialization (?0? [hex]) of all output values occurs.
The ?Coordination? is realized with a state machine. Different states with a de?ned setting of corresponding
output variables are existing as well as clear conditions to change from one state to another. The calculation
of the adaptation values is controlled by the states of the state machine.
By means of the logical constant LC_MFF_ADD_ER_BAL_ENA it is possible to enable (LC_MFF_ADD_ER_BAL_
ENA = 1) or disable (LC_MFF_ADD_ER_BAL_ENA = 0) the additive adaptation during catalyst heating and a
calibratable time after.
In order to compensate torque differences, e.g. caused by manufacturing tolerances of the injection valves,
either an additive or a multiple adaptation correction of the injection times is carried out at state ?Cylinder
Balancing? depending on the current mass fuel ?ow setpoint.
The additive adaptation value, which in?uences the offset of the injection valve characteristic line is learned at
low mass fuel ?ow values. The multiple adaptation factor however, which in?uences the slop of the injector
characteristic line, is learned at higher mass fuel ?ow values (refer: ?gure below).

� Application Conditions
Initialisation: -

Deactivation: LC_TI_ER_BAL_STOP_MAN = 1
Recurrence: segment synchronous
� Function Description
Activation conditions for cylinder balancing TI intervention calculation
IF C_TI_ER_BAL_ACT_MAN = "Enable" ( 1H)
THEN LV_TI_ER_BAL_ACT = 1
ELSEIF C_TI_ER_BAL_ACT_MAN = "Disable" ( 2H)
THEN LV_TI_ER_BAL_ACT = 0
ELSE ( C_TI_ER_BAL_ACT_MAN is set to "Neutral" ( 0H) )
IF STATE_TI_ER_BAL = "Cylinder Balancing" (3H)
THEN LV_TI_ER_BAL_ACT = 1
ELSE LV_TI_ER_BAL_ACT = 0
ENDIF
ENDIF

Basic condition to enable cylinder balancing manager calculations
IF ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(IN <NC_FID_FCT_TI_ER_BAL>) AND
LV_ENA_ER =1 AND
LV_SEG_AD_AVL_ER = 1 AND
LV_SEG_AD_LIM_ER = 0 AND
LV_FCUT_IND = 0
THEN LV_CYL_BAL_ER_CDN_BAS = 1
ELSE LV_CYL_BAL_ER_CDN_BAS = 0
External condition to enable cylinder balancing manager calculations
IF LV_CYL_BAL_ER_CDN_BAS = 1 AND
LV_PUC = 0 AND
TQI_AV > C_TQI_MIN_TI_ER_BAL AND
TQI_AV < C_TQI_MAX_TI_ER_BAL AND
T_AST > C_T_AST_MIN_TI_ER_BAL AND
VS <= C_VS_MAX_TI_ER_BAL AND
STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG = "NO" AND
LV_TI_ER_BAL_CH_ENA = 1
THEN LV_MFF_COR_ER_BAL_ENA_EXT = 1
ELSE LV_MFF_COR_ER_BAL_ENA_EXT = 0
ENDIF
External conditions to enable balancing adaptation manager calculations
MFF_SP_BAL = MFF_SP_MV
IF (LV_DRV1_STND_BAL_FDOUT = 0 (acceleration fade out) AND
LV_MFF_COR_ER_BAL_ENA_EXT = 1)
THEN LV_TI_ER_BAL_ENA = 1
ELSE LV_TI_ER_BAL_ENA = 0
ENDIF
IF abs(ER_STND_MMV_BAL[SEG_NR_ER]) > C_ER_STND_MMV_MAX_TI_ER_BAL
THEN LV_ER_STND_MMV_MAX_TI_ER_BAL = 1
ELSE LV_ER_STND_MMV_MAX_TI_ER_BAL = 0
ENDIF
IF abs(ER_STD_MMV_BAL[SEG_NR_ER]) > C_ER_STD_MMV_MAX_TI_ER_BAL
THEN LV_ER_STD_MMV_MAX_TI_ER_BAL = 1
ELSE LV_ER_STD_MMV_MAX_TI_ER_BAL = 0

Figure 12.2.2:
State diagram:
Cylinder Balancing Manager: State 0H - ?Initialization?
At Reset the state of cylinder balancing changes at once to state ?Initialization?.
The state ?Initialization" is active for one recurrence (first segment after
Reset). As soon as the next segment (second segment after Reset) is valid, the
state changes immediately to state "Lock"
Assignments at entry to state ?Initialization?:
STATE_TI_ER_BAL Initialization [0H]
Action:
Transition to State 1[H] ?Lock?
(always after one recurrence of state 0 ?Initialization?)
Assignments at exit from state ?Initialization?:
No assignments
Cylinder Balancing Manager: State 1[H] - ?Lock?
The algorithm stays in this state until the flags LV_TI_ER_BAL_ENA is set to
?1?. This flag is set when certain conditions for controlling and adaptation
are fulfilled.

LV_TI_ER_BAL_CH_ENA is an enabling condition for CYBL TI/MFF Intervention, it is set at catalyst heating and
a calibratable time after catalyst heating. Maximum enabling time after start T_AST_BAL (no reset at STST) is
C_T_AST_MAX_TI_ER_BAL.

AND

T_TI_ER_BAL_AFT_CH = 0
ELSE(2)

AND

THEN(3) T_TI_ER_BAL_AFT_CH =
T_TI_ER_BAL_AFT_CH + 0.1s
ELSE(3) LV_TI_ER_BAL_CH_ENA = 0
END(3)
END(2)

END(1)
ELSE(0) LV_TI_ER_BAL_CH_ENA = 0

CYBL, Cylinder balancing via engine roughness
12.3.1.1 External aging and coding correction values for cylinder balancing
This module is used as interface module between the project speci?c key word protocol (KWP) and the generic
cylinder balancing functionality. The KWP provides for every piezo injector an absolute MFF value, which is
determined at end of injector production line and imported to the ECU at vehicle production.
To take the aging of each injector into consideration, the distance since the last injector change is calculated.
The determined distance is basic for an additive MFF offset value out of an interpolation table.
It is possible to adjust default values provided by a constant array instead of the input values from the key
word protocol (KWP). For this purpose a separate switch (logical constant) is existing to manage the absolute
MFF set point values. In serial production, always the KWP values have to be used.

� Function Description
12.4.2.1 Settings at manual stop
A logical calibration constant is available to stop all cylinder balancing interventions at once. In case of LC_ER_
BAL_HOM_STOP_MAN = 1, several activation conditions for the cylinder balancing functions are disabled (=0).
If the logical constant is enabled (=1), a re-initialisation (?0? [hex])of all output values occurs.
Calculations at manual stop:
IF LC_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP_MAN = 1 or
LC_FAC_ER_BAL_HOM_RST_MAN = 1 or
LC_FAC_AD_ER_BAL_HOM_RST_MAN = 1 or
LV_FAC_ER_BAL_HOM_EXT_ADJ = 1
THEN LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 1
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ACK = 0
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ACK_EXT = 0
CTR_SEG_DLY_ACK_ER_BAL_HOM = 0 [-]
IF LC_TI_ER_BAL_STOP_MAN = 1
THEN LV_DRV1_ER_BAL_ACT = 0
LV_ER_STND_ER_BAL_ACT = 0
ELSE // in case of no manual stop - see section "engine speed limitation"
ENDIF

CYBL, Cylinder balancing via engine roughness (Appl. Inc.)
12.4.2.2 Engine speed limitation
With use of an engine speed constant it is possible to stop cylinder balancing above a de?ned engine speed
to save system resources. As soon as the engine speed is below the threshold value again, all calculations
continue immediately.
Stop of cylinder balancing above engine speed threshold:
IF LC_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP_MAN = 0 and
LC_FAC_ER_BAL_HOM_RST_MAN = 0 and
LC_FAC_AD_ER_BAL_HOM_RST_MAN = 0 and
LV_FAC_ER_BAL_HOM_EXT_ADJ = 0
THEN
IF N > C_N_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM
THEN LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 1
LV_DRV1_ER_BAL_ACT = 0
LV_ER_STND_ER_BAL_ACT = 0
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ACK_EXT = 0
ELSE LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 0
ENDIF
12.4.2.3 External balancing acknowledge
After cylinder balancing is requested, a couple of settings have to be done at other interfering functions to allow
a stable balancing later on. An external acknowledge information is calculated to indicate that all necessary
adjustments in front of cylinder balancing activation are available.
// cylinder balancing external acknowledge condition
IF(1) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 0
THEN(1)
// calculation of acknowledge delay timer value
IF(2) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CDN = 0
THEN(2) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ACK_EXT = 0
CTR_SEG_DLY_ACK_ER_BAL_HOM = C_CTR_SEG_DLY_ACK_ER_BAL_HOM
// segment counter initialization for balancing acknowledge
ELSE(2)
IF(3) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CMB_MOD_ENA_CUS = 1
THEN(3)
IF(4) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_FUP_SP_REQ = 1
THEN(4)
IF(5) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA_EXT = 1 and
FUP_SP > FUP_SP_REQ_ER_BAL_HOM -
C_FUP_SP_HYS_RNG_IS_ER_BAL_HOM and
FUP_SP < FUP_SP_REQ_ER_BAL_HOM +
C_FUP_SP_HYS_RNG_IS_ER_BAL_HOM
THEN(5) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ACK_EXT = 1
ELSEIF(5) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA_EXT = 0 and
FUP_SP > FUP_SP_REQ_ER_BAL_HOM -
C_FUP_SP_HYS_ER_BAL_HOM and

ENDIF(5)

ENDIF(4)

ENDIF(3)
ENDIF(2)

12.4.2.4 Adjustment via service tool
This application incidence module is used as interface module between the project speci?c key word protocol
(KWP) and the generic cylinder balancing functionality. The KWP provides a request ?ag to reset the learned
cylinder balancing adaptation values. A reset has to be done after every change of an injection valve or
requested via service tool.

THEN
IF LC_FAC_ER_BAL_HOM_EXT_ADJ_MAN = 1 or
LV_FAC_ER_BAL_HOM_EXT_ADJ_KWP = 1 or
STATE_IV_CHG <> 0
THEN LV_FAC_ER_BAL_HOM_EXT_ADJ = 1
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleAd(IN <1>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleCtl(IN <1>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleCtlIni(IN <1>,IN <1>)

ENDIF

ENDIF
12.4.2.5 Manual reset via calibration
In case of a manual reset it is possible to adjust the cylinder balancing volatile variables as well as all non
volatile variables (adaptation variables) to neutral values to make the function test and handling more easier.
While the manual function reset is activated, all concerned cylinder balancing modules are deactivated.
//Calculation of activation condition for balancing external adjustment
IF LC_FAC_ER_BAL_HOM_RST_MAN = 1 and
LC_FAC_AD_ER_BAL_HOM_RST_MAN = 0
THEN //Manual reset of volatile variables
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleAd(IN <1>,IN <0>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleCtl(IN <1>,IN <0>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleCtlIni(IN <1>,IN <0>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleDC(IN <1>,IN <0>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleDiag(IN <1>,IN <0>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleDiagMis(IN <1>,IN <0>)
ACTION_CYBL_GetStatusAdClr(OUT<LV_ER_BAL_HOM_AD_CLR>)
ELSEIF LC_FAC_ER_BAL_HOM_RST_MAN = 0 and
LC_FAC_AD_ER_BAL_HOM_RST_MAN = 1
THEN //Manual reset of non volatile variables
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleAd(IN <0>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleCtl(IN <0>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleCtlIni(IN <0>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleDC(IN <0>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleDiag(IN <0>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleDiagMis(IN <0>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_GetStatusAdClr(OUT<LV_ER_BAL_HOM_AD_CLR>)
ELSEIF LC_FAC_ER_BAL_HOM_RST_MAN = 1 and
LC_FAC_AD_ER_BAL_HOM_RST_MAN = 1
THEN //Manual reset of volatile and non volatile variables
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleAd(IN <1>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleCtl(IN <1>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleCtlIni(IN <1>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleDC(IN <1>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleDiag(IN <1>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleDiagMis(IN <1>,IN <1>)
ACTION_CYBL_GetStatusAdClr(OUT<LV_ER_BAL_HOM_AD_CLR>)
ENDIF

12.4.2.6 ECU handshake for master-slave
For systems using a master/slave concept, it must be ensured at any time that cylinder balancing is running
only at one engine control unit (either master or slave). The function activation (active lean shift) at both engine
control units at the same time is strictly prohibited.
To ensure the blocking mechanism, a handshake between master- and slave engine control unit is required. By
default, the master engine control unit will force cylinder balancing at slave engine control unit at ?rst engine
run if possible.
After one successful ?nished adaptation cycle at master engine control unit, cylinder balancing at slave engine
control unit is forced. As soon as a successful adaptation cycle is ?nished at slave engine control unit, enabling
is changing again and so on.
For non master-slave systems, cylinder balancing is enabled at available engine control unit at any time.
12.4.2.6.1 Balancing enabled at both ECUs
# IF (1) NC_STATE_ECU_MST_SLA <> "NOT_MST_SLA" (0H)

// safety condition check, only for for robustness

LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ECU_ENA_COPL == 1
THEN(2) // slave disables function if function is enabled at
both ECUs
IF (3) LV_ECU_SLA = 1
THEN (3) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ECU_ENA = 0
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ECU_SWI_REQ = 0
ENDIF (3)

LV_FAC_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC_COPL == 0) or

LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_KWP_COPL = 1]
AND

ENDIF (3)
IF (3) ( LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ECU_SWI_REQ == 1 and

After cylinder balancing is requested, a couple of settings have to be done at other interfering functions to
allow a stable balancing later on. An acknowledge information is received to sign that all necessary settings
are available.

Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit
LC_MFF_ADD_AD_ER_BAL_RST_MAN V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Manual reset of additive adaptation values for cylinder balancing via MFF intervention
LC_MFF_ADD_ER_BAL_COR V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Manual switch for overall correction of controller output values for cylinder balancing via MFF intervention
LC_MFF_ADD_ER_BAL_RST_MAN V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Manual reset of additive correction values for cylinder balancing via MFF intervention
� General Information
The calculation of the additive correction- or adaptation values is performed, depending on the settings of the
corresponding logical activation variable. LV_MFF_ADD_ER_BAL_ENA is used to enable the correction path,
while LV_MFF_ADD_AD_ER_BAL_ENA enables the adaptation path. As soon as the corresponding logical value
is set to "1" in combination with additional activation conditions, the calculation is started.
The calculated additive adaptation value MFF_ADD_AD_ER_BAL[NC_CYL_NR] for each cylinder is stored in the
non-volatile memory to be available for initialization issues at next engine run.
With use of the manual reset it is possible to initialize the additive correction- or adaptation values with zero at
any time. In this case, the ?ags which indicate the exceeding of a controller output limitation are set to zero as
well (refer: "Initialization at Manual Reset")

12.5.2.1 Calculation of manual reset, injection time correction and injection time adaptation
Manual reset of additive correction values
In case of a manual reset it is possible to adjust the exported output data to a wanted value to make
the function test and handling more easier. While the manual function reset is activated, all following
subchapters within the module "Cylinder balancing via additive MFF intervention" are deactivated and the
corresponding "Initialization at Deactivation" process for this chapters is blocked during this period.

12.5.2.1.2 Calculation of the additive injection time correction values
The calculation of the additive injection time correction values are only performed if the corresponding en-
able bit LV_MFF_ADD_ER_BAL_ENA is set to logical ?1? in combination with additional activation conditions.
In this case, a separate correction value for each cylinder is determined with use of a PI-controller.
As soon as a PI-controller of one cylinder is reaching its maximum, a corresponding value is set to ?1? to
indicate the related cylinder. To save memory resources, the information for all cylinders is located within
one output data (WORD). Each BIT information within the WORD is used to indicate one cylinder. It is
possible to handle up to 16 cylinders with this method.
For a description more in detail please have a look to the signal ?ow diagram below. As example, a six-
cylinder engine with two PI-controllers, which have reached the limits is shown.
Signal ?ow diagram:
- Signalization of controller max. output value reached for additive path
Figure 12.5.13:
Note: always the complete WORD (16 BIT) is displayed as visible value

12.5.2.1.2.3 Controller Equations
For the additive correction mode, a separate set of NC_CYL_NR controllers exists operating in parallel (one
controller for each cylinder).
The computation of the output values is carried out every C_CYCNR_MFF_ADD_ER_BAL engine cycles (=
calibrateable number of engine cycles).
Only in case of C_CYCNR_MFF_ADD_ER_BAL = 1, the calculation of the additive path is done without inter-
ruption. At every segment the corresponding cylinder speci?c correction value is built.
If the computation is not done at every engine cycle (C_CYCNR_MFF_ADD_ER_BAL >1), the trigger of the
controller output calculation is always related to SEG_NR_ER = 0.

Figure 12.5.28:
12.5.2.1.2.6 Observation of corrected controller output values for OBD issues
The additive correction values out of the correction path are observed for OBD purposes. As soon as the
minimum or maximum diagnosis threshold is exceeded, a corresponding ?ag for the related cylinder is set.
In this case the OBD system is indicated to handle the further failure treatment. The diagnosis thresholds
have always to be less or equal to the absolute minimum or maximum controller output limits.

12.5.2.1.3 Calculation of the additive injection time adaptation values
The corrected NC_CYL_NR controller output values are adjusted dependent on the corresponding segment
number SEG_NR_ER. During the function is activated, at every new segment the corresponding MFF_ADD_
ER_BAL value is updated. Due to this correction the sum of all adaptation output values remains zero to
guarantee that the overall injection spreading stays unchanged.

12.5.2.1.3.3 Initialization at Exit from additive injection time correction
As soon as the additive injection time correction is disabled in combination with the manual switch to force
the overall correction (LC_MFF_ADD_ER_BAL_COR), the controller output values are set to zero.
The initialization only takes place, if the logical constant for a manual reset of the additive controller values
is set to zero (LC_MFF_ADD_ER_BAL_RST_MAN = 0).

� General Information
Cylinder balancing homogenous means an adaptation of the cylinder individual injected fuel mass values at
homogenous combustion mode to achieve a balancing of the indicated torque between the single cylinders
based on engine roughness calculation. Target is to achieve a smooth engine running.
The Balancing Management is realized with a state machine. Different states with a de?ned setting of corre-
sponding output variables are existing as well as clear conditions to change from one state to another. The
calculation of the adaptation values is controlled by the states of the state machine.
In order to compensate torque differences, e.g. caused by manufacturing tolerances of the injection valves,
either a low range or a high range adaptation of the injected fuel mass is carried out at state Cylinder Balancing
depending on the actual calibration.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST, Deactivation
Activation: LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP==0
Deactivation: LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP==1
Recurrence: SEG

� Function Description
12.7.3.1 Calculation of MAF integral
Calculation of air mass ?ow integral above a certain vehicle speed. The integral must be above a calibratable
temperature dependent threshold, to avoid a bad in?uence on engine roughness caused by a cold gearbox
oil temperature.
IF(0) LC_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP_MAN = 0 AND LV_ER_BAL_HOM_MAF_INT_ENA = 0
THEN(0)
IF(1) VS >= C_VS_MIN_ER_BAL_HOM
THEN(1) MAF_INT_ER_BAL_HOM =
(MAF_CYL * T_SAMPLE[ms] * 1/3600 [g*h/(kg*ms)) +
MAF_INT_ER_BAL_HOM
ENDIF(1)
IF(1) MAF_INT_ER_BAL_HOM >= IP_MAF_INT_ER_BAL_HOM(TAM)
THEN(1) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_MAF_INT_ENA = 1
ENDIF(1)
ENDIF(0)

12.7.5.1 Gear change detection
Gear change detection to enable cylinder balancing homogenous calculations
IF GEAR(n) <> GEAR(n-1)
THEN CTR_SEG_GEAR_ENA_ER_BAL_HOM = C_NR_SEG_GEAR_ENA_ER_BAL_HOM
ELSE
IF CTR_SEG_GEAR_ENA_ER_BAL_HOM <> 0
THEN CTR_SEG_GEAR_ENA_ER_BAL_HOM - -
ENDIF
ENDIF
12.7.5.2 External condition for balancing
The Appl. Inc. module is used to keep the cylinder balancing functions modular. Therefore the activation
conditions for the signal preparation functions, the balancing manager and the cylinder balancing adaptation
functions are set within this module. The cylinder balancing functions are activated as soon as the correspond-
ing activation condition is enabled (=1).
With the logical variable LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_EXT it is possible to adapt the main enable condition (to start
cylinder balancing at homogenous combustion mode) with additional external requirements. The ?ag is used
as input signal for the cylinder balancing manager.
With the logical variable LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_L(H)_ENA_EXT it is possible to adapt the main adaptation con-
dition (to start cylinder balancing adaptation at homogenous combustion mode) with additional external re-
quirements. The ?ag is used as input signal for the cylinder balancing manager.

12.7.5.3 Basic external enable condition
Determination of maximum catalyst temperature for cylinder balancing homogenous
IDX_TEMP_CAT = 0
IDX_LAMB_SP = 0
FOR m = 0 to NC_CBK_EX_NR - 1
//Determination of maximum catalyst temperature for cylinder balancing
IF TEMP_CAT_DYN_MDL[m] > C_TEMP_CAT_MAX_BAL_HOM
THEN IDX_TEMP_CAT = 1
ENDIF
//Determination of lambda set point hysteresis for cylinder balancing
IF LAMB_SP[m] > (1 + C_LAMB_SP_HYS_MAX_BAL_HOM) or
LAMB_SP[m] < (1 - C_LAMB_SP_HYS_MAX_BAL_HOM)
THEN IDX_LAMB_SP = 1
ENDIF
END FOR
Basic condition to enable cylinder balancing homogenous manager calculations
IF { start if-condition ...
LV_CH = 0 AND
LV_ENA_ER_BAL = 1 AND
LV_FCUT_IND = 0 AND
LV_ECU_LOCK = 0 AND
LV_INH_ER_BAL_HOM = 0 AND
LV_TI_MIN = 0 AND
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CBK_EX_NR-1,LV_LAM_LSCL[i]) = NC_CBK_EX_NR AND
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CBK_EX_NR-1,LV_CAT_PURGE_ACT[i]) = 0 AND
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CBK_EX_NR-1,LV_LAM_ORNG_LAM_AD_REQ[i]) = 0 AND
IDX_TEMP_CAT = 0 AND
IDX_LAMB_SP = 0 AND
(STATE_ER_BAL_HOM = ?Cylinder Balancing? (3H) or
[LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA_EXT = 0 and
CL_MMV <= C_CL_MMV_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM] or
[LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA_EXT = 1 and
CL_MMV <= C_CL_MMV_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS] or
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_LAM_LIM = 1 )
... end if-condition }
OR
CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_EXT_MAN[bit position 0] = 1
THEN LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_EXT = 1
ELSE LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_EXT = 0
ENDIF
// Annotation: SUM(i=0:1:NC_CBK_EX_NR-1,LV_xxx[i]) = yy means:
// sum of all NC_CBK_EX_NR number of flags LV_xx must be yy

� General Information
Task of this module is to coordinate the correction- and adaptation factors calculated ba the function "Cylinder
balancing via active lean shift". Only one set of correction factors are existing, while the set of adaptation factors
are equal to the number of de?ned adaptation ranges for cylinder balancing at homogenous combustion
mode.
With use of the correction values, de?ned lambda lean- and lambda rich shifts for all cylinders have to be
executed to make the homogenous cylinder balancing strategy possible. A reduction of lambda deviations for
every single cylinder is achieved after cons9deration of the learned adaptation values.

12.8.2.1 Manual reset (via calibration switch)
In case of a manual reset it is possible to adjust the output data to neutral values to make the function test and
handling more easily. While the manual function reset is activated, all following subchapters within the module
"Coordination of the Injection Time Correction Factors for CYBL" are deactivated during the period.

12.8.2.2 Interface values at engine stop
The formula section is only activated if the switch for a manual reset is set to "0". In case of a manual reset
(refer: "Manual Reset of cylinder balancing correction values"), the calculations are stopped at once.
The calculation of the total cylinder balancing correction output values takes place at engine stop and engine
start in ?xed time steps. The output values are used to adjust the wanted cylinder individual corrections. All
total cylinder correction values ( for every cylinder) are calculated within one time step during this period.

12.8.2.5 Interface values at engine run
The formula section is only activated if the switch for a manual reset is set to "0". In case of a manual reset
(refer: "manual Reset of cylinder balancing correction values"), the calculations are stopped at once.
Finally, the calculation of the total cylinder balancing correction output values takes place. The output values
are used to adjust the wanted cylinder individual corrections. All injection valve correction values are calculated
at any engine operating area depending of the chosen control strategy.

� General Information
The engine roughness signal ER_BAL_REF as well as the dynamic part of the engine roughness signal ER_DRV1_
BAL_REF are used as basis for the calculation of the input signal for the cylinder balancing control functions.
The calculations are kept cylinder individual corresponding on the actual segment number NR_SEG_BAL_
REF.
The module "Engine roughness signal preparation for cylinder balancing" is divided in two separate chapters.
Within the ?rst part the calculation of the input signals for the cylinder balancing controller is done, while the
second part is providing fade out conditions while cylinder balancing has to be interrupted.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: SEG

Figure 12.9.4:
12.9.2.1 Calculation of variables at NVMSTO task
The ER values are used to calculate normalized cylinder selective engine roughness values ER_STND_BAL.
After normalization (multiplication by N_32?3), the cylinder selective values are ?ltered by a Median Filter and
a PT1-Filter.
In addition, moving mean values are built (ER_STND_MMV_STD_BAL[NR_SEG_BAL_REF]) for the calculation of
cylinder speci?c standard deviations (ER_STD_BAL[NR_SEG_BAL_REF]).
The standard deviation ER_STD_DIF_BAL is calculated by subtracting the moving mean values ER_STND_MMV_
STD_BAL[NR_SEG_BAL_REF] from the ER_STND_BAL values.
The resulting difference ER_STD_DIF_BAL is multiplied with a weighting factor for negative and positive val-
ues (C_FAC_ER_STD_NEG/POS_BAL). Afterwards a moving mean value is calculated based on this weighted
signal.
To allow a cylinder speci?c adaptation via the engine roughness, a speci?c signal has to be created for each
cylinder. Therefore, from the variable ER_STND_MMV_BAL[NR_SEG_BAL_REF] the value ER_STND_MMV_MV_
BAL (average value of all cylinder speci?c moving mean values) is subtracted.
The values ER_STD_MMV_BAL[NR_SEG_BAL_REF], ER_STND_MMV_BAL[NR_SEG_BAL_REF] and ER_STND_MMV_
STD_BAL[NR_SEG_BAL_REF] are stored in the non-volatile memory (NVMY) and used for initialization issues at
next engine run.

12.9.2.2 Calculation of cylinder balancing acceleration fade out conditions
Multiplying the dynamic component (DRV1_ER) part of the engine roughness calculation with the engine speed
by the power of three normalizes the signal. The de?ned signal is reproducing the engine acceleration in
numbers. If the acceleration is quite high or low, in case of speeding up or down, the cylinder balancing
adaptation is stopped for a certain number of segments. The number of segments are stored in a counter,
which is counting back to zero in certain steps as mentioned in the signal ?ow diagram.

12.10.2.1 Cylinder balancing - segment allocation
For systems using a master/slave concept, a mapping of the actual available engine roughness segment num-
ber to the corresponding cylinder number hast to be done for every engine control unit (either master or
slave) to ensure a proper working of cylinder balancing at every unit.

� General Information
The calculation of the correction- and adaptation values is performed, depending on the settings of the cor-
responding logical activation variable. As soon as the corresponding logical value is set to ?1? in combination
with additional activation conditions, the calculation is started.
The calculated additive adaptation values FAC_COR_AD_RNG_L(H)_ER_BAL_HOM[NC_CYL_NR] for each cylin-
der is stored in the non-volatile memory to be available for initialization issues at next engine run.
With use of the manual reset it is possible to initialize the correction and adaptation values with zero at any
time. In this case, the ?ags which indicate the exceeding of the controller output limitation are set to zero as
well (refer: ?Initialization at Manual Reset?)

12.11.2.1 ACTION_CYBL_IniValueRngAdEntry
// at action call the following calculations are performed
IF(1) Ad_Rng_Entry = 0[H]
THEN(1) // init of controller values with adaptation LOW range values
FOR(2) i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] = FAC_COR_AD_RNG_L_CLC_BAL_HOM[i]
ENDFOR(2)
ELSEIF(1) Ad_Rng_Entry = 1[H]
THEN(1) // init of controller values with adaptation HIGH range values
FOR(2) i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] = FAC_COR_AD_RNG_H_CLC_BAL_HOM[i]
ENDFOR(2)
ELSEIF(1) Ad_Rng_Entry = 2[H]
THEN(1) // init of controller values with adaptation IS range values
FOR(2) i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] = FAC_COR_AD_RNG_IS_CLC_BAL_HOM[i]
ENDFOR(2)
ENDIF(1)
12.11.2.2 ACTION_CYBL_GetStatusAdClr
// at action call the following calculations are performed
IF SUM( i=0:1:NC_CYL_NR-1,ABS(FAC_COR_AD_RNG_L_ER_BAL_HOM[i])) = 0[%] and
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CYL_NR-1,ABS(FAC_COR_AD_RNG_H_ER_BAL_HOM[i])) = 0[%] and
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CYL_NR-1,ABS(FAC_COR_AD_RNG_IS_ER_BAL_HOM[i])) = 0[%] and
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CYL_NR-1,ABS(FAC_COR_AD_RNG_L_CLC_BAL_HOM[i])) = 0[-] and
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CYL_NR-1,ABS(FAC_COR_AD_RNG_H_CLC_BAL_HOM[i])) = 0[-] and
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CYL_NR-1,ABS(FAC_COR_AD_RNG_IS_CLC_BAL_HOM[i]))= 0[-]
THEN LV_STATE_AD_CLR = 1
ELSE LV_STATE_AD_CLR = 0

12.11.3 Cylinder balancing adaptation
� General Information
The calculation of the correction and adaptation values is only performed if the corresponding activation bit
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ACT is set to logical ?1? in combination with additional activation conditions. In this case, a
separate correction value for the active lean shifted cylinder as well as the rich shifted cylinders of the same
cylinder bank are determined with use of a I-controller with P-offset value.
� Application Conditions
Activation: LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 0 and
LV_MIS_DET_BAL_HOM = 0 and
STATE_ER_BAL_HOM = "CYLINDER BALANCING" [3H]
Deactivation: LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 1 or
LV_MIS_DET_BAL_HOM = 1 or
STATE_ER_BAL_HOM <> "CYLINDER BALANCING" [3H]
Recurrence: segment synchronous

CYBL, Cylinder balancing adaptation
12.11.3.1 Check of adaptation readiness
// Determination of learned cylinders per exhaust bank
FOR(1) m = 0 to NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM - 1
IF(2) NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[m][IDX_BAL_HOM] = NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM
// check if lean shift of all cylinders per exhaust bank is completed
THEN(2) IDX_BAL_CBK = m
// temporary storage of exhaust bank number with completed lean shift
ENDIF(2)
ENDFOR(1)
12.11.3.2 Calculation of adaptation factor
// Calculation of correction adaptation factor for each cylinder
IF(1) NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK][IDX_BAL_HOM] =
NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM
// check if exhaust bank with completed lean shift is available
THEN(1)
12.11.3.2.1 Lean shift factors - summary
// reset of bank specific correction values from previous calculation
FAC_COR_CBK_ER_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK] = 0
LV_FAC_COR_AD_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK] = 0
// summary of bank specific correction factors
FOR(2) i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
IF(3) CLF_IDX_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[bit position i] == IDX_BAL_CBK
THEN(3) FAC_COR_CBK_ER_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK] =
FAC_COR_CBK_ER_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK] +
FAC_COR_BUF_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i]
ENDIF(3)
ENDFOR(2)
12.11.3.2.2 Lean shift factors - spread
// maximum spread of lean shift factors per exhaust bank
FAC_COR_DIF_CBK_BAL_HOM = 0
FAC_COR_DIF_MAX_CBK_BAL_HOM = 0
FAC_COR_DIF_MIN_CBK_BAL_HOM = 0
FAC_COR_MV_CBK_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK] =
FAC_COR_CBK_ER_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK] *
(NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM / NC_CYL_NR)
// exhaust bank specific mean value of lean shift factors
FOR(2) i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
IF(3) CLF_IDX_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[bit position i] == IDX_BAL_CBK
THEN(3) FAC_COR_DIF_PRE_ER_BAL_HOM[i] =
FAC_COR_BUF_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] -
FAC_COR_MV_CBK_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK]
IF(4) | FAC_COR_DIF_PRE_ER_BAL_HOM[i]| >
FAC_COR_DIF_CBK_BAL_HOM
THEN(4) FAC_COR_DIF_CBK_BAL_HOM =
|FAC_COR_DIF_PRE_ER_BAL_HOM[i] |
File: 30801O02.00H
3813Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

Copyright �Continental AG. Transmittal, reproduction, dissemination and/or editing of this document as well as utilisation of its contents and communication thereof to others without
expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
CYBL, Cylinder balancing adaptation
ENDIF(4)
IF(4) FAC_COR_DIF_PRE_ER_BAL_HOM[i] >
FAC_COR_DIF_MAX_CBK_BAL_HOM
THEN(4) FAC_COR_DIF_MAX_CBK_BAL_HOM =
FAC_COR_DIF_PRE_ER_BAL_HOM[i]
ENDIF(4)
IF(4) FAC_COR_DIF_PRE_ER_BAL_HOM[i] <
FAC_COR_DIF_MIN_CBK_BAL_HOM
THEN(4) FAC_COR_DIF_MIN_CBK_BAL_HOM =
FAC_COR_DIF_PRE_ER_BAL_HOM[i]
ENDIF(4)
ENDIF(3)
ENDFOR(2)
FAC_IDX_BAL = FAC_COR_DIF_CBK_BAL_HOM
12.11.3.2.3 Lean shift factors - diagnosis
// Monitoring of predicted AD values based on lean-shift factors
ACTION_CYBL_GetCdnDiagPre
(IN<IDX_BAL_CBK>, IN<IDX_BAL_HOM>,
IN<FAC_COR_DIF_PRE_ER_BAL_HOM[NC_CYL_NR]>)
// Storage of old adaptation values for ghost counter operation
FOR(2) i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
IF(3) CLF_IDX_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[bit position i] == IDX_BAL_CBK
THEN(3) FAC_COR_AD_RNG_L_OLD_BAL_HOM[i] =
FAC_COR_AD_RNG_L_ER_BAL_HOM[i]
FAC_COR_AD_RNG_H_OLD_BAL_HOM[i] =
FAC_COR_AD_RNG_H_ER_BAL_HOM[i]
ENDIF(3)
ENDFOR(2)
12.11.3.2.4 Adaptation factors at range IS
// calculation of cylinder adaptation value for range idle speed
IF(2) IDX_BAL_HOM == 2[H]
// activated adaptation range is idle speed (2[H] == "IS")
THEN(2) // weighting factor calculation
NR_IDX_BAL = NR_CYC_AD_DC_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_HOM]
FAC_COR_AD_BAS_ER_BAL_HOM =
ID_FAC_COR_AD_ER_BAL_HOM * IP_FAC_COR_AD_FAST_ER_BAL_HOM
FOR(3) i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
// adaptation value calculation
IF(4) CLF_IDX_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[bit position i] ==
IDX_BAL_CBK
THEN(4) FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] =
FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] +
ID_FAC_COR_AD_ER_BAL_HOM *
IP_FAC_COR_AD_FAST_ER_BAL_HOM *
{( FAC_COR_BUF_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] *
(NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM) ) -
FAC_COR_CBK_ER_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK] }
ENDIF (4)
END FOR (3)
// Within SW code rounding errors have to be avoided at multiplication
with IP table (multiplication with NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM
necessary)

12.11.3.2.5 Adaptation factors out of range IS
// calculation of cylinder adaptation value for range low/high
ELSE(2) // weighting factor calculation
N_IDX_BAL = N_OFS_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK][IDX_BAL_HOM]
MFF_IDX_BAL = MFF_SP_OFS_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK][IDX_BAL_HOM]
FAC_COR_AD_BAS_ER_BAL_HOM =
IP_FAC_COR_AD_ER_BAL_HOM * IP_FAC_COR_AD_FAST_ER_BAL_HOM
FOR(3) i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
// adaptation value calculation
IF(4) CLF_IDX_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[bit position i] ==
IDX_BAL_CBK
THEN(4) FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] =
FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] +
IP_FAC_COR_AD_ER_BAL_HOM *
IP_FAC_COR_AD_FAST_ER_BAL_HOM *
{( FAC_COR_BUF_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] *
(NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM) ) -
FAC_COR_CBK_ER_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK] }
ENDIF(4)
ENDFOR(3)
// Within SW code rounding errors have to be avoided at multiplication
with IP table (multiplication with NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM
necessary)
ENDIF (2)
12.11.3.2.6 Limitation of ?nal adaptation factor values
// determination and correction of adaptation factor limits
FOR(2) i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
IF(3) CLF_IDX_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[bit position i] == IDX_BAL_CBK
THEN(3)
IF(4) //adaptation values out of maximum limit
FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] >
( C_FAC_COR_AD_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM *
(NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM) )
THEN(4) //determination of adaptation correction factor
LV_FAC_COR_AD_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK] = 1
IDX = ( C_FAC_COR_AD_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM *
(NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM) ) /
FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i]
//limitation of adaptation values to max limit
FOR(5) x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
IF(6) CLF_IDX_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[bit position x]==
IDX_BAL_CBK
THEN(6) FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[x] =
FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[x] *IDX
ENDIF(6)
ENDFOR(5)
ELSEIF(4) //adaptation values out of minimum limit
FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] <
( C_FAC_COR_AD_MIN_ER_BAL_HOM *
(NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM) )

THEN(4) //determination of adaptation correction factor
LV_FAC_COR_AD_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK] = 1
IDX = ( C_FAC_COR_AD_MIN_ER_BAL_HOM *
(NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM) ) /

//limitation of adaptation values to min limit
FOR(5) x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
IF(6) CLF_IDX_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[bit position x]==
IDX_BAL_CBK
THEN(6) FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[x] =

ENDIF(6)
ENDFOR(5)
ENDIF(4)
ENDIF(3)
ENDFOR(2)
12.11.3.2.7 Final cylinder adaptation factors
// mapping and limitation of adaptation values to activation range
FOR(2) i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
IF(3) CLF_IDX_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[bit position i] == IDX_BAL_CBK
THEN(3) // adaptation factor update
IF(4) IDX_BAL_HOM = 0[H]
THEN(4) FAC_COR_AD_RNG_L_CLC_BAL_HOM[i] =
FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i]
FAC_COR_AD_RNG_L_ER_BAL_HOM[i] =
{ FAC_COR_AD_RNG_L_CLC_BAL_HOM[i] /
( NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM ) } * [%]
ELSEIF(4) IDX_BAL_HOM = 1[H]
THEN(4) FAC_COR_AD_RNG_H_CLC_BAL_HOM[i] =
FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i]
FAC_COR_AD_RNG_H_ER_BAL_HOM[i] =
{ FAC_COR_AD_RNG_H_CLC_BAL_HOM[i] /
( NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM ) } * [%]
ELSEIF(4) IDX_BAL_HOM = 2[H]
THEN(4) FAC_COR_AD_RNG_IS_CLC_BAL_HOM[i] =
FAC_COR_AD_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i]
FAC_COR_AD_RNG_IS_ER_BAL_HOM[i] =
{ FAC_COR_AD_RNG_IS_CLC_BAL_HOM[i] /
( NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM ) } * [%]
ENDIF (4)
// Within SW code rounding errors have to be avoided (division
with NC_CYL_NR / NC_CBK_NR necessary)
ENDIF(3)
ENDFOR(2)

12.11.3.2.9 Bank prioritization for next AD loop
// Prioritization of exhaust bank for next adaptation loop
IF(2) ( FAC_COR_DIF_MAX_CBK_BAL_HOM >
C_FAC_COR_DIF_MAX_CBK_BAL_HOM or
FAC_COR_DIF_MIN_CBK_BAL_HOM <
C_FAC_COR_DIF_MIN_CBK_BAL_HOM )
THEN(2) NR_COR_DIF_CBK_BAL_HOM ++
// Bank prioritization reset in case of max repeats reached
IF(3) NR_COR_DIF_CBK_BAL_HOM > C_NR_COR_DIF_MAX_CBK_BAL_HOM
THEN(3) NR_COR_DIF_CBK_BAL_HOM = 0
ENDIF(3)
ELSE(2) NR_COR_DIF_CBK_BAL_HOM = 0
ENDIF(2)
12.11.3.2.10 Adaptation prioritization management
//Pre calculations for ghost counter and diagnosis prioritization
IF(2) IDX_BAL_HOM <> 2[H]
// adaptation range idle speed (2[H] == "IS") not active
THEN(2) FAC_COR_AD_MAX_PRI_BAL_HOM = 0
FAC_COR_AD_MIN_PRI_BAL_HOM = 0
// Number of adaptations with low cylinder balancing effort
IF(3) ( FAC_COR_DIF_MAX_CBK_BAL_HOM <
C_FAC_COR_PRI_MIN_TOL_BAL_HOM and
FAC_COR_DIF_MIN_CBK_BAL_HOM >
C_FAC_COR_PRI_MIN_BOL_BAL_HOM )
THEN(3) NR_PRI_DIAG_MIN_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK] ++
ENDIF(3)
// Number of adaptations with high cylinder balancing effort
IF(3) ( FAC_COR_DIF_MAX_CBK_BAL_HOM >
C_FAC_COR_PRI_MAX_TOL_BAL_HOM or
FAC_COR_DIF_MIN_CBK_BAL_HOM <
C_FAC_COR_PRI_MAX_BOL_BAL_HOM )
THEN(3) NR_PRI_DIAG_MAX_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK] ++
ENDIF(3)
// Determination of min/max adaptation range values
FOR(3) i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
IF(4) FAC_COR_AD_DIAG_BAL_HOM[i] >
FAC_COR_AD_MAX_PRI_BAL_HOM
THEN(4) FAC_COR_AD_MAX_PRI_BAL_HOM =
FAC_COR_AD_DIAG_BAL_HOM[i]
ELSEIF(4) FAC_COR_AD_DIAG_BAL_HOM[i] <
FAC_COR_AD_MIN_PRI_BAL_HOM
THEN(4) FAC_COR_AD_MIN_PRI_BAL_HOM =
FAC_COR_AD_DIAG_BAL_HOM[i]
ENDIF(4)
ENDFOR(3)
ENDIF(2)

12.11.4 Ghost counter management
� General Information
If the diagnosis result (no symptom) is available quite fast before the imbalance diagnosis is ?nished, no fur-
ther active lean shift is necessary to reach the diagnosis end condition. This is only the case, if the spread
of the available lean shift values are within strong temporary thresholds for several loops. A ghost counter is
activated in this case to control the active lean shift as well as to force the imbalance diagnosis until end of
diagnosis is reached.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: -
Activation: LC_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 0
Deactivation: LC_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG = 0 or
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 1
Recurrence: segment synchronous
� Function Description
12.11.4.1 Calculation at deactivation
//at function deactivation the following calculation is performed
IF LC_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG = 0
THEN LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG = 0
STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI = [0H] "NORMAL"
ENDIF
12.11.4.2 Calculation at activation
//at function activation the following calculation is performed

CYBL, Cylinder balancing adaptation
12.11.4.2.1 Ghost counter activation condition
IF(1) STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI = [0H] "NORMAL" and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG_END = 0
THEN(1)
//determination of imbalance diagnosis prioritization effort
FOR(2) m = 0 to NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM - 1
IF(3) NR_PRI_DIAG_MAX_BAL_HOM[m] > C_NR_PRI_DIAG_MAX_BAL_HOM
THEN(3) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG_MAX[m] = 1
ENDIF(3)
IF(3) NR_PRI_DIAG_MIN_BAL_HOM[m] > C_NR_PRI_DIAG_MIN_BAL_HOM
THEN(3) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG_MIN[m] = 1
ENDIF(3)
ENDFOR(2)
//diagnosis prioritization increase due to high detected effort
IF(2) SUM( m=0:1:NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM-1,...
...LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG_MAX[m]) > 0
THEN(2) STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI = [2H] "HIGH"
//diagnosis prioritization decrease due to low detected effort
ELSEIF(2) [ FAC_COR_AD_MAX_PRI_BAL_HOM <
C_FAC_COR_AD_MAX_PRI_BAL_HOM and
FAC_COR_AD_MIN_PRI_BAL_HOM >
C_FAC_COR_AD_MIN_PRI_BAL_HOM and
SUM(m=0:1:NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM-1,...
...LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG_MIN[m]) ==
NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM ]
THEN(2) STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI = [1H] "LOW"
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG = 1
ENDIF(2)
ENDIF(1)
12.11.4.2.2 Ghost counter end condition
IF(1) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG_END = 0 and
SUM(m=0:1:NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM-1,...
...LV_END_DIAG_ER_BAL_HOM_RBM[m]) == NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM
THEN(1) //reset of imbalance diagnosis prioritization
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG = 0
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG_END = 1
IF(2) STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI = [0H] "NORM"
THEN(2) STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI = C_STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_0
ELSEIF(2) STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI = [1H] "LOW"
THEN(2) STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI = C_STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_1
ELSEIF(2) STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI = [2H] "HIGH"
THEN(2) STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI = C_STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_2
ENDIF(2)
//setting of diagnosis prioritization at end of imbalance diagnosis
ENDIF(1)

THEN(1)
IF(2) STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_DC == "Adaptation" [2H] and

THEN(4) //Monitoring of predicted AD values - range low

(IN<IDX_BAL_CBK>, IN<0>,

//Monitoring of confirmed AD values - range low

(IN <IDX_BAL_CBK>, IN<0>)
ELSEIF(4) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_H_ENA == 1 and
LC_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG_CBK == 0
THEN(4) //Monitoring of predicted AD values - range high
ACTION_CYBL_GetCdnDiagPre
(IN<IDX_BAL_CBK>, IN<1>,
IN<FAC_COR_DIF_PRE_ER_BAL_HOM[NC_CYL_NR]>)
//Monitoring of confirmed AD values - range high
ACTION_CYBL_GetCdnDiagAd
(IN <IDX_BAL_CBK>, IN<1>)
ELSEIF(4) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_L_ENA == 1 and
LC_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG_CBK == 1
THEN(4)
FOR(5) m = 0 to NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM - 1
//Monitoring of predicted AD values - rng low
ACTION_CYBL_GetCdnDiagPre
(IN<m>, IN<0>,
IN<FAC_COR_DIF_PRE_ER_BAL_HOM[NC_CYL_NR]>)
//Monitoring of confirmed AD values - rng low
ACTION_CYBL_GetCdnDiagAd
(IN <m>, IN<0>)
ENDFOR(5)
ELSEIF(4) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_H_ENA == 1 and
LC_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG_CBK == 1

THEN(4)
FOR(5) m = 0 to NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM - 1
//Monitoring of predicted AD values - rng high
ACTION_CYBL_GetCdnDiagPre
(IN<m>, IN<1>,
IN<FAC_COR_DIF_PRE_ER_BAL_HOM[NC_CYL_NR]>)
//Monitoring of confirmed AD values - rng high
ACTION_CYBL_GetCdnDiagAd
(IN <m>, IN<1>)
ENDFOR(5)
ENDIF(4)
//Ghost counter reset for next virtual AD cycle
CTR_PRI_DIAG_BAL_HOM = 0
//Diagnosis number increment for next virtual AD cycle
IF(4) LC_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG_CBK == 0
THEN(4) NR_PRI_DIAG_MIN_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_CBK] ++
ELSE(4)
FOR(5) m = 0 to NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM - 1
NR_PRI_DIAG_MIN_BAL_HOM[m] ++
ENDFOR(5)
ENDIF(4)
ENDIF(3)
ELSE(2)
//determination of virtual AD bank by ghost counter
IDX = 0[H]
FOR(3) m = 0 to ( NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM ) - 1
IF(4) CTR_PRI_DIAG_BAL_HOM >=
NR_SEG_AD_CBK_BAL_HOM *
[(m + 1)/(NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM)]
THEN(4) IDX = m + 1
ENNDIF(4)
ENDFOR(4)
//Ghost counter reset for next virtual cylinder AD cycle
CTR_PRI_DIAG_BAL_HOM =
NR_SEG_AD_CBK_BAL_HOM *
[ IDX /(NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM)]
ENDIF(2)
ELSE(1)
//Ghost counter reset because of deactivation or end of diagnosis
CTR_PRI_DIAG_BAL_HOM = 0
ENDIF(1)

� General Information
The calculation of the correction- and adaptation values is performed, depending on the settings of the corre-
sponding logical activation variable. As soon as the corresponding logical value is set to ?1? in combination
with additional activation conditions, the calculation is started.
The calculated additive adaptation values FAC_COR_AD_RNG_L(H)_ER_BAL_HOM[NC_CYL_NR] for each cylin-
der is stored in the non-volatile memory to be available for initialization issues at next engine run.
With use of the manual reset it is possible to initialize the correction and adaptation values with zero at any
time. In this case, the ?ags which indicate the exceeding of the controller output limitation are set to zero
as well (refer: ?Initialization at Manual Reset?)
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST, CLRFMY, NVMRES, NVMINI, NVMSTO

12.12.2.1.1.1.3 Mis?re lock at active lean shift
Cylinder balancing can be interrupted by e.g. limited dynamics in real time, but the mis?re detection is delayed.
Therefore a buffer is needed, to check if cylinder balancing was active just before the mis?re is detected.
CTR_SEG_BUF_ER_BAL_HOM[NC_CYL_NR] buffers CTR_SEG_ER_BAL_HOM to check if a mis?re event happened
during a cylinder balancing lean shift.
? CTR_SEG_BUF_ER_BAL_HOM[NC_CYL_NR-1] = CTR_SEG_BUF_ER_BAL_HOM[NC_CYL_NR-2]
? .....
? CTR_SEG_BUF_ER_BAL_HOM[1] = CTR_SEG_BUF_ER_BAL_HOM[0]
? CTR_SEG_BUF_ER_BAL_HOM[0] =
CTR_SEG_ER_BAL_HOM
actual CTR_SEG_BUF_ER_BAL_HOM[newest, ......, oldest] is observed in the next recurrence of the seg-task:
? CTR_SEG_BUF_ER_BAL_HOM[0] = 1 SEG delay
? ......
? CTR_SEG_BUF_ER_BAL_HOM[NC_CYL_NR-1] = # NC_CYL_NR delays
The delay can be calibrated with C_CTR_SEG_DLY_ER_BAL_HOM:
C_CTR_SEG_DLY_ER_BAL_HOM = 0 ->observes CTR_SEG_BUF_ER_BAL_HOM[0] ->1 SEG delay

CYBL, Cylinder balancing controller
Temporary number of mis?re events at lean shifted cylinder
� General Information
The calculation of the correction- and adaptation values is performed, depending on the settings of the cor-
responding logical activation variable. As soon as the corresponding logical value is set to ?1? in combination
with additional activation conditions, the calculation is started.
The calculated additive adaptation values FAC_COR_AD_RNG_L(H)_ER_BAL_HOM[NC_CYL_NR] for each cylin-
der is stored in the non-volatile memory to be available for initialization issues at next engine run.
With use of the manual reset it is possible to initialize the correction and adaptation values with zero at any
time. In this case, the ?ags which indicate the exceeding of the controller output limitation are set to zero as
well (refer: ?Initialization at Manual Reset?)
12.13.1 Main application conditions
� General Information
� Application Conditions
Activation: See separate chapters
Deactivation: See separate chapters
Recurrence: See separate chapters
� Function Description
12.13.1.1 Non volatile memory ini (NVMINI)
Initialization at first Engine run or NVMY-error:
FOR x = 0 to NC_NR_RNG_BAL_HOM - 1
NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[x] = 0 (first initialization)
END FOR
FOR m = 0 to NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM - 1
FOR x = 0 to NC_NR_RNG_BAL_HOM - 1
NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[m][x] = 0 [-] (first initialization)
N_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x] = 0 [rpm] (first initialization)
MFF_SP_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x] = 0 [mg/stk] (first initialization)
END FOR
END FOR
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleCtl(IN<1>,IN<0>)
12.13.1.2 Non volatile memory read (NVMRES)
Initialization (read) of non volatile memory:
FOR x = 0 to NC_NR_RNG_BAL_HOM - 1
NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[x] = NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[x] (NVMY)
(NVMY: values stored in the non-volatile memory)
END FOR
FOR m = 0 to NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM - 1
FOR x = 0 to NC_NR_RNG_BAL_HOM - 1
NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[m][x] = NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[m][x] (NVMY)
N_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x] = N_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x] (NVMY)
MFF_SP_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x] = MFF_SP_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x] (NVMY)
(NVMY: values stored in the non-volatile memory
END FOR
END FOR

12.13.1.3 Non volatile memory store (NVMSTO)
Saving (store) of non volatile memory:
FOR x = 0 to NC_NR_RNG_BAL_HOM - 1
NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[x] (NVMY) = NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[x]
(NVMY: values stored in the non-volatile memory)
END FOR
FOR m = 0 to NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM - 1
FOR x = 0 to NC_NR_RNG_BAL_HOM - 1
NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[m][x] (NVMY) = NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[m][x]
N_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x] (NVMY) = N_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x]
MFF_SP_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x] (NVMY) = MFF_SP_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x]
(NVMY: values stored in the non-volatile memory
END FOR
END FOR
12.13.1.4 Initialization at reset (RST)
Initialization at Reset:
FOR i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
FAC_COR_ER_BAL_HOM[i] = 0 [%]
FAC_COR_BUF_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] = 0 [%]
NR_SEG_AD_CYL_BAL_HOM[i] = 0 [-]
END FOR
FAC_COR_OFS_ER_BAL_HOM = 0 [%]
ER_STND_MMV_PRE_BAL_HOM = 0 [1/s?2]
ER_STND_MMV_DIF_BAL_HOM = 0 [1/s?2]
ER_STND_MMV_OFS_BAL_HOM = 0 [1/s?2]
ER_STND_MMV_RAW_BAL_HOM = 0 [1/s?2]
FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM = 0 [%]
FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM_CYL = 0 [%]
FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM_CBK = 0 [%]
FAC_CTL_I_ER_BAL_HOM = 0 [%]
FAC_CTL_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM = 0 [%]
LV_FAC_CTL_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM = 0 [-]
NR_SEG_AD_CBK_BAL_HOM = 0 [-]
CTR_SEG_AD_CYL_BAL_HOM = 0 [0]
CTR_SEG_ER_BAL_HOM = NC_CYL_NR
CTR_IDX_BAL = 0 [-]
IDX_FIL_OFS = 0 [-]
N_PRE_BAL_HOM = 0 [rpm]
N_CUR_BAL_HOM = 0 [rpm]
MFF_SP_PRE_BAL_HOM = 0 [mg/stk]
MFF_SP_CUR_BAL_HOM = 0 [mg/stk]
MFF_SP_IDX_BAL = 0 [mg/stk]
IF (1) LC_FAC_ER_BAL_HOM_NVMY_MAN = 0
THEN (1) // initialization of controller transfer values at reset:
FOR (2) x = 0 to NC_NR_RNG_BAL_HOM - 1
NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[x] = 0 [-]
END FOR (2)
FOR (2) m = 0 to NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM - 1
FOR (3) x = 0 to NC_NR_RNG_BAL_HOM - 1
NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[m][x] = 0 [-]
N_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x] = 0 [rpm
MFF_SP_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x] = 0 [mg/stk]
END FOR (3)
END FOR (2)
ELSEIF (1) LC_FAC_ER_BAL_HOM_NVMY_MAN = 1 and
LC_FAC_ER_BAL_HOM_NVMY_CBK_MAN = 1

CYBL, Cylinder balancing controller
THEN (1) // exhaust bank specific initialization of controller transfer
values at reset
FOR (2) x = 0 to NC_NR_RNG_BAL_HOM - 1
// number of learned cylinders for completed exhaust banks,
% == modulo function (mod)
NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[x] = NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[x]-[NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[x]%
(NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM )]
// index value for start of initialization in respect of
completed exhaust banks
idx= NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[x] * (NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM / NC_CYL_NR)
// setting of non completed exhaust bank variables to
initialization value
FOR (3) m = idx to NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM - 1
NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[m][x] = 0 [-]
N_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x] = 0 [rpm
MFF_SP_OFS_BAL_HOM[m][x] = 0 [mg/stk]
END FOR (3)
ENDFOR (2)
ENDIF (1)
12.13.2 Action de?nition
� General Information
� Application Conditions
Activation: at action call
Deactivation: non
� Function Description
12.13.2.1 ACTION_CYBL_SetValueRngAdEntry
// at action call the following calculations are performed
CTR_IDX_BAL = Nr_Mis_Det
CTR_SEG_AD_CYL_BAL_HOM = C_CTR_SEG_AD_CYL_OFS_BAL_HOM
FAC_COR_OFS_ER_BAL_HOM = ID_FAC_COR_OFS_ER_BAL_HOM(CTR_IDX_BAL)
IF CTR_IDX_BAL > 0
THEN CTR_SEG_ER_BAL_HOM =
IP_CTR_SEG_INI_ER_BAL_HOM + C_CTR_SEG_OFS_ER_BAL_HOM
ENDIF
FOR i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
FAC_COR_BUF_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[i] = Buf_Tmp_Value[i]

12.13.2.2 ACTION_CYBL_IniValueRngAdExit
// at action call the following calculations are performed
ER_STND_MMV_PRE_BAL_HOM = 0
ER_STND_MMV_DIF_BAL_HOM = 0
ER_STND_MMV_OFS_BAL_HOM = 0
ER_STND_MMV_RAW_BAL_HOM = 0
FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM = 0
FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM_CYL = 0
FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM_CBK = 0
FAC_CTL_I_ER_BAL_HOM = 0
LV_FAC_CTL_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM = 0
FAC_COR_OFS_ER_BAL_HOM = 0
CTR_SEG_ER_BAL_HOM = NC_CYL_NR
CTR_SEG_AD_CYL_BAL_HOM = 0
IDX_FIL_OFS = 0 [-]
FOR i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
FAC_COR_ER_BAL_HOM[i] = 0
END FOR
12.13.2.3 ACTION_CYBL_IniValueAdLoop
// at action call the following calculations are performed
NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[Ad_Bank][Ad_Range] = 0 [-]
N_OFS_BAL_HOM[Ad_Bank][Ad_Range] = 0 [rpm]
MFF_SP_OFS_BAL_HOM[Ad_Bank][Ad_Range] = 0 [mg/stk]
IF Ad_Prio > 0 and
LV_END_DIAG_ER_BAL_HOM_RBM[Ad_Bank] == 0
THEN NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[Ad_Range] =
NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[Ad_Range] - (NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM)
ELSEIF SUM( m=0:1:NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM-1,LV_END_DIAG_ER_BAL_HOM_RBM[m]) <
NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM
//check if at least one bank specific RBM flag is not yet available
THEN NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[Ad_Range] = NC_CYL_NR
FOR[m = (Ad_Bank + 1); m < NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM; m++]
IF NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[Ad_Range] == NC_CYL_NR and
LV_END_DIAG_ER_BAL_HOM_RBM[m] == 0
THEN NR_CYL_BAL_HOM[Ad_Range] =
(m * NC_CYL_NR/NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM)
ENDIF
ENDFOR
ENDIF
NR_SEG_AD_CBK_BAL_HOM =
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CYL_NR-1,NR_SEG_AD_CYL_BAL_HOM[i]) / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM
// Annotation: SUM(m=0:1:NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM-1,LV_END_DIAG_ER_BAL_HOM_RBM[m])
<
// NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM means: sum of all exhaust bank specific RBM end flags
// must be less than number of available cylinder balancing exhaust banks

FORm = 0 to NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM - 1

CTR_IDX_BAL = 0 [-]

CYBL, Cylinder balancing controller
12.13.3 Cylinder lean shift
� General Information
The calculation of the correction and adaptation values is only performed if the cylinder balancing state STATE_
ER_BAL_HOM is set to logical ?cylinder balancing?. In this case, a separate correction value for the active
lean shifted cylinder as well as the rich shifted cylinders of the same cylinder bank are determined with use
of a I-controller with P-offset value.
As soon as the PI-value of the lean shifted cylinder is reaching its maximum, a logical ?ag is set to ?1? to
indicate the related cylinder. To save memory resources, the information for all cylinders is located within
one output data (WORD). Each BIT information within the WORD is used to indicate one cylinder. It is
possible to handle up to 16 cylinders with this method.
For a description more in detail please have a look to the signal ?ow diagram below. As example, a six-
cylinder engine with two PI-values, which have reached the limits, is shown.
� Application Conditions
Activation: LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 0 and
LV_MIS_DET_BAL_HOM = 0 and
STATE_ER_BAL_HOM = "CYLINDER BALANCING" [3H]
Deactivation: LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 1 or
LV_MIS_DET_BAL_HOM = 1 or
STATE_ER_BAL_HOM <> "CYLINDER BALANCING" [3H]
Recurrence: segment synchronous
� Function Description
� Signal ?ow diagram:
- Signalization of controller max. output value reached for active lean shifted cylinder

Note: always the complete WORD (16 BIT) is displayed as visible value

12.13.3.1 Increment of cylinder segment counter
//increment of cylinder segment adaptation values for ghost counter
CTR_SEG_AD_CYL_BAL_HOM ++
12.13.3.2 Pre-settings and offset calculations
// calculation of segment delay, engine speed / load offset at lean shift
IF (1) CTR_SEG_ER_BAL_HOM <> 0
THEN (1)
12.13.3.2.1 Decrement of lean-shift delay counter
// decrement of segment delay counter in front of new lean shift
CTR_SEG_ER_BAL_HOM --
12.13.3.2.2 Setting ER values before lean shift
// setting of previous engine roughness value in front of active lean
shift
IF (2) NR_SEG_BAL_REF == NR_SEG_BAL_HOM
THEN (2) ER_STND_MMV_PRE_BAL_HOM =
ER_STND_MMV_DIF_BAL[NR_SEG_BAL_HOM]
ENDIF (2)
// setting of previous engine speed and engine load values in front of
active lean shift
12.13.3.2.3 Setting N values before lean shift
N_PRE_BAL_HOM = N
N_CUR_BAL_HOM = 0 [rpm]
12.13.3.2.4 Setting MFF values before lean shift
MFF_SP_PRE_BAL_HOM = MFF_SP_MV
MFF_SP_CUR_BAL_HOM = 0 [mg/stk]
ELSE (1)
12.13.3.2.5 Calculation N offset at lean shift
// calculation of the engine speed offset at active lean shift
IF (2) | N - N_PRE_BAL_HOM | > N_CUR_BAL_HOM
THEN (2) N_CUR_BAL_HOM = | N - N_PRE_BAL_HOM |
ENDIF (2)
12.13.3.2.6 Calculation MFF offset at lean shift
// calculation of the engine load offset at active lean shift
IF (2) | MFF_SP_MV - MFF_SP_PRE_BAL_HOM | > MFF_SP_CUR_BAL_HOM
THEN (2) MFF_SP_CUR_BAL_HOM = | MFF_SP_MV - MFF_SP_PRE_BAL_HOM |
ENDIF (2)
ENDIF (1)

12.13.3.3 Determination of lean-shift ratio
IF (1) ( LC_ER_STND_OFS_DET_BAL_HOM == 0 and
CTR_SEG_ER_BAL_HOM == 0 )
OR
(LC_ER_STND_OFS_DET_BAL_HOM == 1 and
CTR_SEG_ER_BAL_HOM <> 0)
THEN (1) // calculation of ER offset interpolation table index value
IF (2) LC_ER_STND_OFS_INP_BAL_HOM == 0
THEN (2) MFF_SP_IDX_BAL =
MFF_SP_IDX_BAL_EXT + MFF_SP_IDX_SUM_BAL_EXT
ELSE (2) MFF_SP_IDX_BAL =
MFF_SP_IDX_BAL_EXT +
MFF_SP_IDX_SUM_BAL_EXT / FAC_MFF_BAL[NR_SEG_BAL_HOM]
ENDIF (2)
12.13.3.3.1 Ratio for low adaptation range
IF (2) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_L_ENA = 1
THEN (2) ER_STND_MMV_RAW_BAL_HOM =
IP_ER_STND_OFS_RNG_L_BAL_HOM
[IDX_OFS_L_BAL_HOM][GEAR_IDX_BAL_HOM] *
FAC_ER_STND_OFS_GEAR_BAL_HOM
12.13.3.3.2 Ratio for high adaptation range
ELSEIF (2) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_H_ENA = 1
THEN (2) ER_STND_MMV_RAW_BAL_HOM =
IP_ER_STND_OFS_RNG_H_BAL_HOM
[IDX_OFS_H_BAL_HOM][GEAR_IDX_BAL_HOM] *
FAC_ER_STND_OFS_GEAR_BAL_HOM
12.13.3.3.3 Ratio for idle speed adaptation range
ELSEIF (2) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA = 1
THEN (2) ER_STND_MMV_RAW_BAL_HOM =
C_ER_STND_OFS_RNG_IS_BAL_HOM
[IDX_OFS_IS_BAL_HOM][GEAR_IDX_BAL_HOM]
ENDIF (2)
12.13.3.3.4 Adaptation range ratio ?lter
IF (2) IDX_FIL_OFS == 0
THEN (2) // initialization of filter variables at first loop
ER_STND_MMV_OFS_BAL_HOM = ER_STND_MMV_RAW_BAL_HOM
IDX_FIL_OFS = 1
ELSE (2) // filtering of raw engine roughness offset value
ER_STND_MMV_OFS_BAL_HOM(n) =
ER_STND_MMV_OFS_BAL_HOM(n-1) *
(1 - C_CRLC_ER_STND_OFS_BAL_HOM) +
ER_STND_MMV_RAW_BAL_HOM *
C_CRLC_ER_STND_OFS_BAL_HOM
ENDIF (2)
ELSE (1)
IDX_FIL_OFS = 0
// index value for initialization of adaptation range ratio filter
ENDIF (1)

12.13.3.4 Calculation of lean-shift correction factors
IF (1) NR_SEG_BAL_REF = 0 and
CTR_SEG_ER_BAL_HOM = 0 and
LV_MIS_DET_BAL_HOM = 0
THEN (1)
12.13.3.4.1 Detection of current lean-shift ratio
// calculation of the engine roughness difference for lean shifted
cylinder
ER_STND_MMV_DIF_BAL_HOM =
ER_STND_MMV_DIF_BAL[NR_SEG_BAL_HOM] -
ER_STND_MMV_OFS_BAL_HOM -
(ER_STND_MMV_PRE_BAL_HOM * C_FAC_ER_STND_MMV_PRE_BAL_HOM )
12.13.3.4.2 PI-controller for active lean-shift
// calculation of factor for cylinder lean shift
IF (2) LV_FAC_CTL_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM = 0
THEN (2) FAC_CTL_I_ER_BAL_HOM(n) =
FAC_CTL_I_ER_BAL_HOM(n-1) + IP_FAC_CTL_I_ER_BAL_HOM
ELSE (2) FAC_CTL_I_ER_BAL_HOM(n) = FAC_CTL_I_ER_BAL_HOM(n-1)
ENDIF (2)
IF (2) CTR_MIS_DET_CFM_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_HOM] = 0
THEN (2) FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM =
C_FAC_CTL_P_ER_BAL_HOM + FAC_CTL_I_ER_BAL_HOM
ELSE (2) FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM = FAC_CTL_I_ER_BAL_HOM
ENDIF (2)
12.13.3.4.3 Lean-shift factor - single cylinder
// limitation of factor for cylinder lean shift
IF (2) FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM <= C_FAC_CTL_MAX_NEG_ER_BAL_HOM
THEN (2) FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM_CYL = C_FAC_CTL_MAX_NEG_ER_BAL_HOM
LV_FAC_CTL_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM = 1
FAC_CTL_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM[bit position NR_SEG_BAL_HOM] = 1
ELSE (2) FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM_CYL = FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM
LV_FAC_CTL_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM = 0
FAC_CTL_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM[bit position NR_SEG_BAL_HOM] = 0
ENDIF (2)
12.13.3.4.4 Lean-shift factor - cylinder bank
// calculation of factor for cylinder rich shift
FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM_CBK = [(-1)*FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM_CYL] /
[(NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM) -1)]
ENDIF (1)
12.13.3.5 Mapping of lean-shift correction factors
12.13.3.5.1 Cylinder bank allocation
IF (1) CLF_IDX_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[bit position NR_SEG_BAL_REF] ==
CLF_IDX_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[bit position NR_SEG_BAL_HOM]
THEN (1)

CYBL, Cylinder balancing controller
12.13.3.5.2 Single cylinder allocation
IF (2) NR_SEG_BAL_REF == NR_SEG_BAL_HOM
THEN (2) FAC_COR_ER_BAL_HOM[NR_SEG_BAL_REF] =
FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM_CYL + FAC_COR_OFS_ER_BAL_HOM
ELSE (2) FAC_COR_ER_BAL_HOM[NR_SEG_BAL_REF] =
[(-1)*(FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM_CYL + FAC_COR_OFS_ER_BAL_HOM)] /
[(NC_CYL_NR / NC_NR_CNK_BAL_HOM) -1]
ENDIF (2)
ENDIF (1)
12.13.3.6 Determined lean-shift ratio reached
// determination of ER difference for active lean shifted cylinder
IF (1) NR_SEG_BAL_REF == NR_SEG_BAL_HOM and
CTR_SEG_ER_BAL_HOM = 0 and
LV_MIS_DET_BAL_HOM = 0
THEN (1)
IF (2) LV_FAC_CTL_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM = 1
or
ER_STND_MMV_DIF_BAL[NR_SEG_BAL_HOM] <
(ER_STND_MMV_PRE_BAL_HOM * C_FAC_ER_STND_MMV_PRE_BAL_HOM )
+ ER_STND_MMV_OFS_BAL_HOM
THEN (2)
12.13.3.6.1 Buffering of cylinder lean-shift factor
IF (3) CTR_MIS_DET_CFM_BAL_HOM[IDX_BAL_HOM] = 0
THEN (3) FAC_COR_BUF_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[NR_SEG_BAL_HOM] =
FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM_CYL
ELSE (3) FAC_COR_BUF_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[NR_SEG_BAL_HOM] =
FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM_CYL +
ID_FAC_COR_OFS_LIM_ER_BAL_HOM(CTR_IDX_BAL)
ENDIF (3)
// maximum limitation of lean-shift factor (max value is zero), no
overrun possible
FAC_COR_BUF_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[NR_SEG_BAL_HOM] =
MIN (FAC_COR_BUF_TMP_ER_BAL_HOM[NR_SEG_BAL_HOM], 0)
12.13.3.6.2 Buffering of N offset at lean shift
IDX = CLF_IDX_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM[bit position NR_SEG_BAL_HOM]
IF (3) N_CUR_BAL_HOM > N_OFS_BAL_HOM[IDX][IDX_BAL_HOM]
THEN (3) N_OFS_BAL_HOM[IDX][IDX_BAL_HOM] = N_CUR_BAL_HOM
ENDIF (3)
12.13.3.6.3 Buffering of MFF offset at lean shift
IF (3) MFF_SP_CUR_BAL_HOM >
MFF_SP_OFS_BAL_HOM[IDX][IDX_BAL_HOM]
THEN (3) MFF_SP_OFS_BAL_HOM[IDX][IDX_BAL_HOM] =
MFF_SP_CUR_BAL_HOM
ENDIF (3)
12.13.3.6.4 Buffering of cylinder segment counter
NR_SEG_AD_CYL_BAL_HOM[NR_SEG_BAL_HOM] = CTR_SEG_AD_CYL_BAL_HOM

FAC_CTL_ER_BAL_HOM_CBK = 0
FAC_CTL_I_ER_BAL_HOM = 0
LV_FAC_CTL_MAX_ER_BAL_HOM = 0
FAC_COR_OFS_ER_BAL_HOM = 0
CTR_SEG_AD_CYL_BAL_HOM = 0
FOR i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
FAC_COR_ER_BAL_HOM[i] = 0
END FOR
ENDIF (2)
ENDIF (1)

Segment counter initialization value for limited dynamics for cylinder balancing homogenous
� General Information
The condition limited dynamics for cylinder balancing at homogenous combustion mode is detected as soon
as the engine speed, the mass air ?ow, the requested engine torque and the mean value of the lambda con-
troller output are all within their corresponding dynamic window. If one condition is leaving the de?ned win-
dow, limited dynamics is no longer present and a segment counter starts to be calculated. Only in case the
segment counter is reaching zero, limited dynamics is given again.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST
Activation: 20MS: always
SEG: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: 20MS, SEG

Within the cylinder balancing package (CYBL), all functions for Cylinder balancing via engine roughness" are
included. This scheduler has to manage the coordination of all involved parts.

Activation: at every engine operating state

12.16.2.1 ACTION_CYBL_GetStatusRngIs
// at action call the following calculations are performed
Determination of actual adaptation range idle speed status
IF NR_CYC_AD_DC_BAL_HOM[2] >= C_NR_CYC_MAX_RNG_IS_ER_BAL_HOM and
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CYL_NR-1,LV_ER_BAL_HOM_IDX_ERR_DIAG[i]) == 0 and
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CYL_NR-1,LV_ER_BAL_HOM_IDX_END_DIAG[i]) == NC_CYL_NR
THEN STATE_AD_RNG_IS = 04H
//Status: range idle speed adaptation finished without failure
(AD_RNG_IS_END_NO_ERR)
ELSEIF NR_CYC_AD_DC_BAL_HOM[2] >= C_NR_CYC_MAX_RNG_IS_ER_BAL_HOM and
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CYL_NR-1,LV_ER_BAL_HOM_IDX_ERR_DIAG[i]) <> 0
THEN STATE_AD_RNG_IS = 02H
//Status: range idle speed adaptation finished with failure
(AD_RNG_IS_END_ERR)
ELSEIF [ NR_CYC_AD_DC_BAL_HOM[2] >= C_NR_CYC_MAX_RNG_IS_ER_BAL_HOM and
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CYL_NR-1,LV_ER_BAL_HOM_IDX_END_DIAG[i]) < NC_CYL_NR ]
OR
[ NR_CYC_AD_DC_BAL_HOM[2] < C_NR_CYC_MAX_RNG_IS_ER_BAL_HOM and
T_RNG_IS_ER_BAL_HOM >= C_T_MAX_RNG_IS_ER_BAL_HOM ]
THEN STATE_AD_RNG_IS = 10H
//Status: range idle speed adaptation finished without result
(AD_RNG_IS_END_NOT_VLD)
ELSEIF STATE_ER_BAL_HOM = ?Cylinder Balancing? (3H)
THEN STATE_AD_RNG_IS = 00H
//Status: range idle speed adaptation enabled and running
(AD_RNG_IS_ENA)
ELSEIF LV_INH_DIAG_ER_BAL_HOM = 1
THEN STATE_AD_RNG_IS = 01H
//Status: range idle speed adaptation inhibit
(AD_RNG_IS_INH)
ELSE STATE_AD_RNG_IS = 08H
//Status: range idle speed adaptation with no result
(AD_RNG_IS_DEAC)
END
// Annotation: SUM(i=0:1:NC_CYL_NR-1,LV_ER_BAL_HOM_IDX_xxx[i]) = y means:
// sum of NC_CYL_NR number of LV_ERR(END)_xxx values must be set to y
12.16.2.2 ACTION_CYBL_SetRngIsEna
// at action call the following calculations are performed
IF LV_RNG_IS_ENA = 1
THEN LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA_KWP = 1
T_RNG_IS_ER_BAL_HOM = 0.0[s]
ELSE LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA_KWP = 0
ENDIF

� Function Description
//Calculation of coolant temperature and time after start for balancing
TCO_ST_BAL = TCO_ST_DC
T_AST_BAL = T_AST_DC_CON
//Combustion mode request for single, double or triple injection mode at balancing
IF(1) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CDN(n) = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CDN(n-1) = 0
THEN(1)
IF(2) CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_CUS_MAN[bit position 4] = 1 or
CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_CUS_MAN[bit position 5] = 1
THEN(2)//request of wanted injection mode for balancing
ACTION_CBMD_SetInh(<NC_IDX_INH_ER_BAL>)
IDX_CMB_BAL = 1
ELSE(2) IDX_CMB_BAL = 0
ENDIF(2)
ELSEIF(1) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CDN(n) = 0 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CDN(n-1) = 1
THEN(1)
IF(2) IDX_CMB_BAL = 1
THEN(2) //clear of requested injection mode for balancing
ACTION_CBMD_ClrInh(<NC_IDX_INH_ER_BAL>)
ENDIF(2)
ENDIF(1)
//Combustion mode detection for start of cylinder balancing
IF(1) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 0
THEN(1)
IF(2) ( IDX_CMB_MOD_CUR = NC_IDX_OPP_1 and
CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_CUS_MAN[bit position 4] = 1 and
CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_CUS_MAN[bit position 5] = 0 )
OR
([ IDX_CMB_MOD_CUR = NC_IDX_OPP_1 or

IDX_CMB_MOD_CUR = NC_IDX_OPP_2_S_1 ] and
CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_CUS_MAN[bit position 4] = 0 and
CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_CUS_MAN[bit position 5] = 1 )
OR
( [ IDX_CMB_MOD_CUR = NC_IDX_OPP_1 or
IDX_CMB_MOD_CUR = NC_IDX_OPP_2_S_1 or
IDX_CMB_MOD_CUR = NC_IDX_OPP_3_HOMS_S ] and
CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_CUS_MAN[bit position 4] = 1 and
CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_CUS_MAN[bit position 5] = 1 )
THEN(2) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CMB_MOD_ENA_CUS = 1

ENDIF(2)
ELSE(1) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CMB_MOD_ENA_CUS = 0
ENDIF(1)
//Calculation of adaptation range idle speed activation condition
IF(1) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 0
THEN(1)
//Calculation of adaptation range idle speed activation time
IF(2) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA_EXT = 1
THEN(2) T_RNG_IS_ER_BAL_HOM = T_RNG_IS_ER_BAL_HOM + 0.1[s]
ENDIF(2)
//Calculation of adaptation range idle speed customer condition
IF(2) LV_IS = 1
THEN(2) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA_CUS = 1
ELSE(2) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA_CUS = 0
ENDIF(2)
ELSE(1) //Initialization of variables at balancing stop condition
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA_CUS = 0
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA_KWP = 0
ENDIF(1)
//Confirmation that customer enable was reset during 100ms task calc.
IF(1) tmp_bal_ena_cus_rst = 1
THEN(1) tmp_bal_ena_cus_rst = 0
ELSE(1) //nothing to do
ENDIF(1)

//Engine operating activation condition for start of balancing
IF(1) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 0
THEN(1)
//Calculation of minimum pulse of current injection mode
MFF_HOM_SP_MIN_ER_BAL_HOM =
MIN(MFF_HOM_SP[NC_CYL_NR][NC_NR_MFF_PLS] != 0)
IF(2) MFF_HOM_SP_MIN_ER_BAL_HOM <
IP_MFF_HOM_SP_MIN_ER_BAL_HOM(FUP_SP)
THEN(2) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_MFF_HOM_SP_MIN = 0
ELSE(2) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_MFF_HOM_SP_MIN = 1
END(2)
//Customer enable condition for start of cylinder balancing
IF(2) CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_CUS_MAN[bit position 0] = 1
//permanent setting of customer enable condition
OR
[ //diagnosis end condition for all cylinders not achieved
LV_ACT_EOL = 0 and
CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_CUS_MAN[bit position 1] = 1 and
SUM(i=0:1:NC_CYL_NR-1,...
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_IDX_END_DIAG[i]) < NC_CYL_NR ]
OR
[ //rate based end condition for all banks not yet achieved
LV_ACT_EOL = 0 and
CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_CUS_MAN[bit position 3] = 1 and
SUM(m=0:1:NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM-1,...
LV_END_DIAG_ER_BAL_HOM_RBM[m]) < NC_NR_CBK_BAL_HOM ]
OR
[ //possibility to run cylinder balancing out of diagnosis
LV_ACT_EOL = 0 and
CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_CUS_MAN[bit position 1] = 0 and
CLF_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_CUS_MAN[bit position 3] = 0 ]
THEN(2)
IF(3) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_MFF_HOM_SP_MIN = 1 and
LV_PORT_DEAC(n) = LV_PORT_DEAC(n-1) and
IDX_CMB_MOD_CUR(n) = IDX_CMB_MOD_CUR(n-1) and
STATE_VLFT_MNG = "VLFT_1" or "VLFT_STND"
THEN(3) tmp_bal_ena_cus = 1
ELSE(3)
IF(4) tmp_bal_ena_cus = 1
THEN(4) tmp_bal_ena_cus = 0

ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleDC(IN <PRM_MAN_RST_VALUE>, IN <PRM_MAN_RST_NVMY>) Mode: O
This action is providing a manual reset for volatile and non volatile variables
Parameter Type Hex.Limits Phys.Limits Resol. Unit
PRM_MAN_RST_VALUE in 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Parameter for manual reset indication of volatile memory values
PRM_MAN_RST_NVMY in 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Parameter for manual reset indication of non volatile memory values
� General Information
Task of the cylinder balancing coordination at DC is to control the adaptation functions during the current
driving cycle.
12.17.1 Application Conditions
� General Information
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: NVMINI, NVMRES, NVMSTO, RST
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: 100MS

LV_FAC_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC = 0 (first initialization)
LV_FAC_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC = 0 (first initialization)
ACTION_CYBL_RstManModuleDC(IN<1>,IN<0>)

(NVMY: values stored in the non-volatile memory)
12.17.1.3 Non volatile memory store (NVMSTO)
Saving (store) of non volatile memory:
T_TOT_BAL_HOM_DC (NVMY) = T_TOT_BAL_HOM_DC
LV_FAC_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC (NVMY) = LV_FAC_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC

(NVMY: values stored in the non-volatile memory)

12.17.3 Manual reset at active DC
� General Information
In case of a manual reset it is possible to adjust the exported output data to a wanted value to make the
function test and handling more easier. While the manual function reset is activated, all following subchapters
within the module "cylinder balancing coordination at DC" are deactivated and the corresponding "Initialization
at Deactivation" process for this chapters is blocked during this period.

Activation: LC_FAC_COR_RST_BAL_HOM_DC = 1
Deactivation: LC_FAC_COR_RST_BAL_HOM_DC = 0
Recurrence: SYS_EVE__100MS

CYBL, Cylinder balancing coordination at DC
12.17.4 Adaptation readiness at active DC
� General Information
A periodic request for cylinder balancing is carried out in de?ned time intervals to allow the start of active lean
shift, which is only activated if several conditions are ful?lled the same time.
� Application Conditions
Activation: LC_FAC_COR_RST_BAL_HOM_DC = 0 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 0 and
LV_ST_END = 1
Deactivation: LC_FAC_COR_RST_BAL_HOM_DC = 1 or
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 1 or
LV_ST_END = 0
Recurrence: 100 ms
� Function Description
12.17.4.1 Calculation at deactivation
IF (1) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP = 1 and
LC_ER_BAL_HOM_STOP_MAN = 0
THEN (1)
STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_DC = "Wait" (0[H])
T_TMP_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s]
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_REQ = 0
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_REQ_IT = 0
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CDN = 0
IF (2) T_TOT_BAL_HOM_DC < C_T_MAX_TOT_BAL_HOM_DC
THEN (2) T_TOT_BAL_HOM_DC = T_TOT_BAL_HOM_DC + 0.1[s]
ENDIF (2)
IF (2) T_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC <> 0.0[s]
THEN (2) T_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC = T_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC - 0.1[s]
ENDIF (2)
IF (2) T_WAIT_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC <> 0.0[s]
THEN (2) T_WAIT_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC = T_WAIT_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC - 0.1[s]
ENDIF (2)
IF (2) T_WAIT_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC <> 0.0[s]
THEN (2) T_WAIT_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC = T_WAIT_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC - 0.1[s]
ENDIF (2)
ENDIF (1)

# IF (1) NC_STATE_ECU_MST_SLA == "NOT_MST_SLA" (0H)

12.17.4.4 Main ?xed time step request
IF (1) T_AST_BAL < C_T_AST_MAX_BAL_HOM_DC and

IF (1) LV_T_STEP_BAL_HOM_DC_IT = 1 or

THEN (1) // DC adaptation requests controlled by fix time steps

T_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC == 0.0[s] and
LV_T_STEP_BAL_HOM_DC_IT = 1)
OR
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA_EXT = 1
OR
(LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_LAM_LIM = 1 and

CYBL, Cylinder balancing coordination at DC
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CDN_ENA = 1)
THEN (2) LV_STATE_CHG_REQ_BAL_HOM_DC = 1
LV_STATE_CHG_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC = 0
LV_T_STEP_BAL_HOM_DC = 1
ELSE (2) LV_STATE_CHG_REQ_BAL_HOM_DC = 0
LV_STATE_CHG_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC = 1
LV_T_STEP_BAL_HOM_DC = 0
ENDIF (2)
// waiting time reset to zero, to allow new adaptation cycles at
next fixed time step
IF (2) T_AST_BAL > ID_T_STEP_BAL_HOM_DC
THEN (2) T_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s]
T_WAIT_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s]
T_WAIT_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s]
ENDIF (2)
12.17.4.6 Temporary time step control at DC
ELSEIF (1) LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG = 1
THEN (1) //DC adaptation requests controlled by temporary time steps
LV_STATE_CHG_REQ_BAL_HOM_DC = 1
LV_STATE_CHG_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC = 0
LV_T_STEP_BAL_HOM_DC = 0
12.17.4.7 Flexible time step control at DC
ELSE (1) // DC adaptation requests for controlled by flexible time steps
LV_T_STEP_BAL_HOM_DC = 0
// waiting time decrement, time gap between adaptation cycles
IF (2) T_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC <> 0.0[s]
THEN (2) T_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC = T_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC - 0.1[s]
ENDIF (2)
// waiting time range low decrement, time gap between range low
adaptation cycles
IF (2) T_WAIT_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC <> 0.0[s]
THEN (2) T_WAIT_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC = T_WAIT_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC - 0.1[s]
ENDIF (2)
// waiting time range high decrement, time gap between range high
adaptation cycles
IF (2) T_WAIT_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC <> 0.0[s]
THEN (2) T_WAIT_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC = T_WAIT_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC - 0.1[s]
ENDIF (2)
IF (2) T_TOT_BAL_HOM_DC < C_T_MAX_TOT_BAL_HOM_DC
THEN (2) T_TOT_BAL_HOM_DC = T_TOT_BAL_HOM_DC + 0.1[s]
// total time increment, flexible time steps running
IF (3) ( LV_FAC_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC = 0 or
LV_FAC_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC = 0)
THEN (3) // enable conditions to change adaptation state
from "Wait" to "Request"
LV_STATE_CHG_REQ_BAL_HOM_DC = 1
LV_STATE_CHG_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC = 0
ELSE (3) // enable conditions to change adaptation state
from "Request" to "Wait"
LV_STATE_CHG_REQ_BAL_HOM_DC = 0
LV_STATE_CHG_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC = 1
ENDIF (3)
ELSE (2) // reset of waiting time, new beginning of flexible time
steps
LV_FAC_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC = 0

T_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s]
T_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s]
T_RNG_NOT_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s]
T_TOT_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s]
T_TMP_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s]
FOR m = 0 to NC_NR_RNG_BAL_HOM - 1
NR_CYC_BAL_HOM_DC[m] = 0
NR_COR_DIF_BAL_HOM_DC[m] = 0

12.17.4.8 State "Wait" - Entry
Note: At function activation always State "Wait" is entered
Assignments at entry to state ?Wait?
STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_DC = "Wait" (0[H])
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_REQ_IT = 0
12.17.4.9 State "Wait" - Actions
No actions during state "Wait"
12.17.4.10 State "Wait" - Exit
Transition to State ?Request? (Condition 1)
// Cylinder balancing driving cycle manager request for change of state
IF LV_STATE_CHG_REQ_BAL_HOM_DC = 1
Assignments at exit from state ?Wait?:
No assignments

Assignments at entry to state ?Request?:
STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_DC = "Request" (1[H])

// conditions for cylinder balancing homogenous achieved
12.17.4.12.1 Conditions range "Low"
IF ( LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CDN_ENA = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_L_ENA = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ECU_ENA = 1 and
T_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s] and
T_WAIT_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s] and
[LV_FAC_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC = 0 or
LV_T_STEP_BAL_HOM_DC = 1 ])
OR

12.17.4.12.2 Conditions range "High"
(LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CDN_ENA = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_H_ENA = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ECU_ENA = 1 and
T_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s] and
T_WAIT_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s] and
[LV_FAC_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC = 0 or
LV_T_STEP_BAL_HOM_DC = 1 ])
OR
12.17.4.12.3 Conditions range "Idle"
(LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CDN_ENA = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ECU_ENA = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_IS_ENA = 1)
OR
12.17.4.12.4 Conditions forced "Ad"
(LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CDN_ENA = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ECU_ENA = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ENA_LAM_LIM = 1 )
OR
12.17.4.12.5 Conditions ghost counter
(LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CDN_ENA = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_ECU_ENA = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG = 1 )
THEN T_TMP_BAL_HOM_DC = T_TMP_BAL_HOM_DC + 0.1[s]
ELSE T_TMP_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s]
ENDIF
12.17.4.12.6 Cylinder balancing request
// calculation of request for cylinder balancing homogenous mode switch
IF T_TMP_BAL_HOM_DC ? C_T_MIN_REQ_BAL_HOM_DC
THEN LV_ER_BAL_HOM_REQ_IT = 1
ELSE LV_ER_BAL_HOM_REQ_IT = 0

CYBL, Cylinder balancing coordination at DC
12.17.4.13 State "Request" - Exit
Transition to State ?Wait? (Time out)
// Cylinder balancing driving cycle manager request for change of state
IF LV_STATE_CHG_WAIT_BAL_HOM_DC = 1
Transition to State ?Adaptation? (Condition 2)
// conditions for cylinder balancing homogenous achieved
IF LC_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_MNG_DC = 0 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_REQ_IT = 1 and
LV_INH_ER_BAL_PRI_MNG = 0
OR
LC_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_MNG_DC = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG = 1 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_REQ_IT = 1
OR
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG = 0 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_REQ_IT = 1 and
LV_INH_ER_BAL_PRI_MNG = 0
OR
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG = 0 and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_REQ_IT = 1 and
LV_T_STEP_BAL_HOM_DC = 1
Assignments at exit from state ?Request?:
T_TMP_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s]
12.17.4.14 State "Adaptation" - Entry
Assignments at entry to state ?Adaptation?:
STATE_ER_BAL_HOM_DC = "Adaptation" (2[H])
T_RNG_NOT_BAL_HOM_DC = 0.0[s]
IF LV_ER_BAL_HOM_PRI_DIAG = 0
THEN LV_ER_BAL_HOM_CDN = 1
ENDIF
12.17.4.15 State "Adaptation" ? Actions
Calculations during state "Adaptation" is active
12.17.4.15.1 Total adaptation time
// calculation of total activation time within state "Adaptation"
T_TMP_BAL_HOM_DC = T_TMP_BAL_HOM_DC + 0.1[s]
12.17.4.15.2 Readiness via AD time
// detection of AD readiness in case of maximum adaptation time elapsed
IF STATE_ER_BAL_HOM = "CYLINDER BALANCING" [3H] and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_L_ENA = 1
THEN T_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC = T_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC + 0.1[s]
ELSEIF STATE_ER_BAL_HOM = "CYLINDER BALANCING" [3H] and
LV_ER_BAL_HOM_RNG_H_ENA = 1
THEN T_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC = T_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC + 0.1[s]
ENDIF
// maximum adaptation time for range low elapsed
IF T_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC > C_T_MAX_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC
THEN LV_FAC_RNG_L_BAL_HOM_DC = 1
ENDIF
// maximum adaptation time for range high elapsed
IF T_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC > C_T_MAX_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC
THEN LV_FAC_RNG_H_BAL_HOM_DC = 1
ENDIF
